quotes.01: “Anyone who has ever made anything of importance was disciplined.” — Andrew Hendrixson
quotes.02: “Don’t spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.” — Coco Chanel
quotes.03: “Creativity is intelligence having fun.” — Albert Einstein
quotes.04: “Optimism is the one quality more associated with success and happiness than any other.” — Brian Tracy
quotes.05: “Always keep your eyes open. Keep watching. Because whatever you see can inspire you.” — Grace Coddington

quotes.01: “It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest I go to than I have ever known.” - A Tale of Two Cities, Charles Dickens
quotes.02: “We are such stuff as dreams are made on, and our little life is rounded with a sleep.” - The Tempest, William Shakespeare
quotes.03: “Whenever you feel like criticizing anyone … just remember that all the people in this world haven’t had the advantages that you’ve had.” - The Great Gatsby, F. Scott Fitzgerald“
quotes.04: “It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.” - Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire, J.K. Rowling

quotes.01: “The greatest thing you’ll ever learn is just to love, and be loved in return.” ~ Moulin Rouge
quotes.02: “To me, you are perfect” ~ Love Actually
quotes.03: “If you’re a bird, I’m a bird.” ~ The Notebook
quotes.04: “The only way you can beat my crazy was by doing something crazy yourself. Thank you. I love you. I knew it the minute I met you. I’m sorry it took so long for me to catch up. I just got stuck.” ~ The Silver Linings Playbook
quotes.05: “I’m also just a girl, standing in front of a boy, asking him to love her.” ~ Notting Hill

quotes.01: “The unexamined life is not worth living” – Socrates
quotes.02: “Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent” – Ludwig Wittgenstein
quotes.03: “The life of man (in a state of nature) is solitary, poor, nasty, brutish, and short” – Thomas Hobbes
quotes.04: “I think therefore I am” (“Cogito, ergo sum”) – René Descartes
quotes.05: “He who thinks great thoughts, often makes great errors” – Martin Heidegger
